TopicTitle: The Mass Key Shipyards Now streaming on twitch

Articles.Content:
I Plan to live stream my Kerbal adventurers and failures, I also might be streaming other games that i play. I have in the past streamed some World of tanks, and plan to try and stream some Day-z standalone sometime, more info in my twitch page.

http://www.twitch.tv/damaske

--Video link removed by Damaske please visit link above if wanting to view--

<iframe frameborder="0" scrolling="no" src="http://twitch.tv/damaske/chat?popout=" height="500" width="350"></iframe>

Edited August 13, 2014 by Damaske

The Mass Key shipyards have taken on the Ion glider to orbit challenge and is now live steaming his entry the triple ion powered "Moth".

Link to Challenge thread.

EDIT: Done for the night thanks to those that showed up and thanks again to those that said hello.

Edited August 6, 2014 by Damaske
Going live in a few moments to show off a Missile carrier i have made, and do some other random stuff.

Going live in a few moments to do some long range tests of the Jumpdrive mod located at parameciumkid's jump drive new models and sound effects

Won't be online for a long time maybe one hour 9am to 10am GMT -7 might push out to 10:30 at latest.

Going to go on-air for a bit to remake the Midget Beta I, And possible start of new career/science mode of the "official" The Mass Key Shipyard series.

4:14am MST -7gmt Aprox time on-air unknown But maybe on-air for an hour.

Edit: I have gone off-air.

Report: After two attempts to reach orbit the new Midget Beta one failed, ditched into the ocean both times due running out of fuel. Current rocket engine choice do not seam to have the power needed to lift craft and fuel into orbit, May need to redesign craft with more fuel for longer air-breather engine flight. Or possible do a twin Raptor engine re-design.

Edited October 15, 2014 by Damaske
